paragraphs.text: 'I witnessed the Peshawar massacre'.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Salam, my name is Ali
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: I am twelve years old
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: We were in between lessons during our first class, when we suddenly heard the sound of shooting
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It was very aggressive noise
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: We did not have time to even imagine what it could be
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Within moments as the noise got closer to our class room our teacher told us to hide beneath our desks
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Get under your desk, fast, get under your desk," she said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Some of us cowered
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Some of us stood confused and panicked
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The whole classroom started asking our teacher"what is happening"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Screaming children from the classrooms next door shocked us
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It scared me so much
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I could not even scream
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Our teacher was just about to lock the door when three militants stormed in the door
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They were already shooting
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I saw my teacher and class fellows immediately get hurt
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Some of my friends started falling down (after being hit)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Many of us went under our tables
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I knew I was going to die and started crying
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Everyone was crying but no one (in my class) tried running away
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They shot my class fellows in the head, in the chest, on their arms, on the legs and in the stomach
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Everyone was on the ground
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Maybe, they knew many of us were alive
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Then they started shooting straight in the skull
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Bullets went over our heads
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My best friend and class bench partner Irfan Ullah told me,"pretend we are dead."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I was shaking with fear
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Our seats are in the last row of the classroom
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Lay still, Ali, Lay still" he whispered to me
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I was turned upside down
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Everything happened very fast
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I knew it was the terrorist
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I knew it was Taliban
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My friend also got hit with bullets
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I don't know which parts of his body but he didn't speak
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I could hear him breath next to me
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: One terrorist screamed to the other,"Is that one dead?"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and then I heard bullets and more shots
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I felt like I was dead
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They spoke in Pashto and were wearing shalwar kameez
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: All of them had long brown beards
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When they left the room, I whispered to Irfan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he didn't respond
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I thought he is playing dead
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I continued(to play dead)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was very scared they will come back
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I don't know when my friend died
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He saved my life
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I thought I was dead
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: my heart was beating very fast
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I couldn't move
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I played dead for several hours
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When the soldiers came to rescue, I could not move and remained still
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I did not know if they were real soldiers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And I could not speak
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was very scared
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I heard constant noise of bullets outside my class but didn't have the strength to open my eyes
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There was huge explosion
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I thought the world will explode today
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: When someone picked me up I kept my eyes closed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It was the army soldiers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I started crying
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They took me to my parents
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I have come here to the hospital
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: So many of my schoolmates are here
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who are short of blood
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am offering my blood for donation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My parents insisted that we should go home
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They are worried about me
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They are sad
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They are scared
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am scared too
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But I am worried about my brothers and sisters who are at the hospital too
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: These Taliban are evil
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: I can't believe I am alive
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: my country needs me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am here to offer my life
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I will fight these terrorists who killed my friends
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I will not forgive them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: God is watching
